title: How accurately can people be identified by voice-identification algorithms? Are voices as unique as fingerprints? - Quora

response.answer_text: on populations of 5–6 K , taking into account voice samples of 16khz with length average of 12 seconds the current state of the art is arround 4% Equal error rate. for more info checkout one the references: http://www.robots.ox.ac.uk/~vgg/data/voxceleb/
